tweet: These findings are extremely troubling and confirm what has been apparent since the start: there is a thumb on the scale favoring objectors. There is no excuse for allowing an opaque, inconsistent, and unfair process to continue harming American manufacturers.

Senator Richard Lugar was a true statesman who worked tirelessly to champion freedom, advance democracy, and build peace and prosperity both at home and abroad. This week the House celebrated his legacy naming a Post Office in Indianapolis in his honor. https://youtu.be/krLxRgIcO_U

I was deeply saddened to learn of the passing of my friend and colleague Rep. Elijah Cummings.
Congress has lost a passionate public servant and a powerful voice for civil rights.
His family and the people he proudly served will be in my prayers.

This week the House took action to reduce homelessness among our nation’s veterans and help them take care of their families when they return to civilian life. I am proud to cosponsor the Homeless Veteran Families Act, which passed the House with my support.

I believe all people deserve to live in a free society where their human rights are respected. Yesterday the House came together and passed the Hong Kong Human Rights and Democracy Act to urge China to support democracy and freedom for the people of Hong Kong.

Thanks @AdvaMedUpdate for fighting to repeal the onerous medical device tax that limits patient access to lifesaving technologies and puts countless jobs at risk. Congress should pass my bipartisan Protect Medical Innovation Act. https://www.realclearpolicy.com/articles/2019/10/07/kill_the_medical_device_tax_111283.html …

Medical devices have changed the way we think about health care, with less invasive procedures, shorter hospital stays, and earlier detection. The medical device tax puts that all at risk. It’s time to repeal it.

 https://www.realclearpolicy.com/articles/2019/10/07/kill_the_medical_device_tax_111283.html …

Hoosiers have seen firsthand the damage of the job-killing medical device tax. I joined with my colleagues on both sides of the aisle to introduce the Protect Medical Innovation Act to fully and permanently repeal this onerous tax. @AdvaMedUpdate

In a letter to the attorney general, 67 House Republicans ask DOJ to assist state investigators and determine whether any federal laws were broken in Klopfer’s transport and storage of thousands of human fetal remains.  http://walorski.house.gov/letter-doj-klopfer …

The Ulrich Klopfer case has countless victims – both unborn babies and mothers – and represents a grotesque violation of human dignity that American society should not and cannot tolerate. http://walorski.house.gov/letter-doj-klopfer …

The discovery of more than 2,200 preserved human fetal remains on the property of a man infamously known as Indiana’s most prolific abortionist reveals a callous disregard for the sanctity of human life. We cannot let this happen again.  http://walorski.house.gov/letter-doj-klopfer …

Read the letter I sent with more than 65 of my colleagues requesting DOJ assist Indiana’s investigation of Ulrich Klopfer and examine state laws regarding dignified disposition of fetal remains.  http://walorski.house.gov/letter-doj-klopfer …
